comment.author: 64346429@N05
comment._content: Best guess would be enroute to Iron Pier at West Brighton Beach (aka Coney Island), the Iron Steamboat Company took passengers from W. 10th St., Franklin Street, Pier 2, N.R., and W. 22nd St. to Coney Island from 1881-1932. www.westland.net/coneyisland/articles/transportation.htm
